conclusion: To determine the magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the current-carrying wire, we need to consider the forces acting on each segment of the wire separately and then combine them.
The wire is folded into a right-angle shape with segments ac and cd.
Segment ac has a length of L.
Segment cd has a length of 2L.
The magnetic force on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by F = BIL, where B is the magnetic field strength, I is the current, and L is the length of the wire segment.
Force on segment ac is Fac = BIL.
Force on segment cd is Fcd = BI(2L) = 2BIL.
The force on ac is perpendicular to ac and directed out of the plane.
The force on cd is perpendicular to cd and directed into the plane.

premise: Forces are perpendicular to each other.
conclusion: Use the Pythagorean theorem to find the resultant force.
